example.eg: 5181 is an odd number.
That's odd that she didn't go directly home after work.
example.egtrans: 她下班后没有直接回家，真是奇怪。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 奇怪的，奇特的, 不寻常的

example.eg: That guy was quite odd.  He kept asking the time.
example.egtrans: 那家伙好古怪，总是问时间。

example.eg: Her clothing is odd, with unfashionable lines, and lots of fur.
example.egtrans: 她着装很奇怪，穿着过时的花纹，还有许多皮草。

example.eg: The Cyclops looks so odd, with just a single eye on his forehead.
example.egtrans: 独眼巨人前额上只有一个眼睛，看起来很古怪。

example.eg: After doing the laundry, there was an odd sock remaining.
example.egtrans: 洗完衣服后，单下一只袜子。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 单只的，单个的, 不成对的

example.eg: Jeff has mostly recovered from his illness, though he still has the odd dizzy spell.
example.egtrans: 杰夫几乎痊愈了，不过还偶有头晕的症状。

example.eg: There were 50-odd people at the party.
example.egtrans: 聚会上大约来了五十个人。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大约的, 大概的, 大概的

example.eg: Ten euros and a few odd cents were left.
example.egtrans: 还剩下10欧元和额外的几分钱。

example.eg: The odds of winning the lottery are not good.
example.egtrans: 彩票中奖的可能性可不高啊。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 可能性, 几率, 概率

example.eg: The celebrity died of an OD.
The doctor told the patient to be careful not to OD.
It is easy to OD on painkillers.

dsense.name: odd and even, odd or even, odds or evens

example.eg: I wish we could find a handyman for odd jobs.  During this recession, I know people who get by working odd jobs.
There are a few odd lots on offer, but nothing substantial.
You've already got four people for a tennis game, so I'm odd man out and will watch.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 单独剩下的一个（人或物）, 格格不入的人（或物）

example.eg: I haven't seen him for years, but he pops into my mind at odd moments.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有空的时候, 空闲的时刻

example.eg: 1, 3, and 5 are all odd numbers.
There was an odd number of students in the class so they worked in pairs apart from one group of three people.
Study the people in the photo for 15 seconds then tell me which is the odd one out.
I've had the odd word with him over the years, but I never really knew him well.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 说过几句话，有过简短交流

dsense.name: odd-jobman (US), odd-job man (UK)
dsense.guideword: (male who does casual manual work) (男性)

example.eg: Alice wasn't sure whether she should eat the odd-looking mushroom.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 相貌奇特的，怪模怪样的
